Issues.Title: Remove full width inconsistency
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.


This was / is annoying the hell out of me when browsing the documentation, when I would go to "hero" or "section" pages, the whole layout would break because it was fullwidth.

Very tiny PR, but also very annoying problem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove full width inconsistency" (#3531)

Issues.Title: .list style is gone by 0.9.4
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem
There is no .list class in 9.0.4 . My app made heavy use of the .list class, and now has significant usability compromises. 

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

his is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4]
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** since I don't see it directly mentioned anywhere in the docs or old PRs

### Description
the old .list and .list-item classes are gone.  Other issues indicate that they might have moved, but none of the docs tell me how to regain my .list functionality. It appears to be gone from the main site, too. What I see on this site doesn't seem to be true of 0.9.4:  https://bulma.dev/classes/list/list

is the absence of .list a bug, or is there a reason it has been removed?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".list style is gone by 0.9.4" (#3532)

Issues.Title: Navbar on mobile is not dark
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about Bulma -- with a dark navbar, when you switch to a mobile view and you open it with the burger, the navbar is light with dark text. I expect the navbar to keep the same styles (`is-dark`) as in desktop, but unfortunately it seems to default to a light menu on mobile.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar on mobile is not dark" (#3530)

Issues.Title: Tabs do not indicate focus well
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**. My users can go through the page elements with the TAB key. This works for many input elements but it does not work well for Tabs. They do not have a proper indication for the focused state. Example: ```
  • Tab 1
  • Tabulator for page 2
``` If you try to focus through the elements with TAB key, you can see it does not indicate focus well on the tabs (tested on Firefox and Chromium). The text input field does focus indication very well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tabs do not indicate focus well" (#3529)

Issues.Title: Change Suggestion for tabs
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma .

This is a request for change the "tabs"-setup in Bulma to reduce JavaScript for a solution .

In the current version of Bulma, you need JS to change the active tab and to 
show a different content-panel associated with the new tab selected.

But there are pure CSS solutions (making use of the :checked-property) 
for this problem if you use radio-buttons instead of the link <a>.
https://codepen.io/markcaron/pen/MvGRYV

Therefore I suggest to base the "tabs" on "radio buttons" and "labels" instead of  <ul> and <a>-tags so that such a pure css solution is feasible to implement.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Change Suggestion for tabs" (#3528)

Issues.Title: Remove duplicate link
Issues.Body: Fix for the duplicate 'love' link in footer: The `site.data.links.more` array already includes 'love': https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/a170216c6cd356cb89b1bdc31e0da1472cbfd2b2/docs/_data/links.json#L694 This is a **documentation fix**.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove duplicate link" (#3527)

Issues.Title: `select` class does not reliably update option selection when using `selected` attribute
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
This is a re-post of https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/3390, which was closed due to inactivity, despite not having been addressed. The issue continues to impact users in production in multiple ways, e.g. https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/321, https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/366, https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/372.

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.1
My **browser** is: Firefox 90.0 (64-bit) and Chromium 92.0.4515.131 (Official Build) snap (64-bit) on Ubuntu 20.10
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Setting the `selected` attribute on an `<option>` of a `<select>` HTML element, using the Bulma `select` class, does not always cause the displayed selected option to change accordingly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Bring up a page containing an instance of the  `select` class which has `<options>`. (For example, https://bulma.io/documentation/form/select/.)
2. Using the browser developer tools, edit one of the `<option>` tags to contain a `selected` attribute, e.g. `<option selected="selected">`.
3. It may be necessary to repeat this a few times, moving the `selected` attribute to different options, before the bug is reproduced.

### Expected behavior

The option selected in the dropdown display changes to match the `<option>` with the `selected` attribute. (This is the behaviour when the same steps are performed on e.g. https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tryit.asp?filename=tryhtml_select).

### Actual behavior

Initially, the actual behaviour may appear to match the expected behaviour. However, after a few repeats of the above steps, the displayed option selection no longer changes when the `selected` attribute is moved. As a result, the underlying value of the dropdown may become different from the value the user thinks it has. (An example of a user-raised issue resulting from this bug can be found here: https://github.com/thoth-pub/thoth/issues/228)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`select` class does not reliably update option selection when using `selected` attribute" (#3524)

Issues.Title: Different column sizes per breakpoint for mobile do not work with default size specified (specificity)
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Firefox and Chrome ### Description Different column sizes per breakpoint do not work for mobile if a default is specified. I guess because of CSS specificity. ### Steps to Reproduce Example to emphasize the issue: ``` html
``` ### Expected behavior The column has full width on the mobile breakpoint ### Actual behavior The column still has 4/12 of width because of specificity (`.columns.is-mobile >` is missing): ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42617635/167931859-01df2cd0-c591-47d4-ace8-7f815f9ae0ec.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Different column sizes per breakpoint for mobile do not work with default size specified (specificity)" (#3525)

Issues.Title: Buttons using is-<info/success/warning/danger> and disabled are white in Safari 15.4
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.3
My **browser** is: Safari 15.4

### Description

Buttons that use the `disabled` attribute, in conjunction with `is-info`/`is-success`/`is-warning`/`is-danger` class are white (so invisible on a white background) but respond correctly when hovered.

Adding an additional class, such as `is-light`/`is-inverted` or removing the `is-success` class results in the disabled button being displayed as expected.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a page with a disabled button. 

    ```html
    <html>
    <head>
	    <link rel="stylesheet" href="./bulma/css/bulma.css">
    </head>
    <body>
	    <button class="button is-success" disabled>Disabled button</button>
	    <button class="button is-success">Enabled button</button>
    </body>
    <html>
    ```

2. Render page in Safari
3. Observe disabled button is rendered in white 

### Expected behavior

Buttons using the `disabled` attribute, in conjunction with `is-success` class, should be rendered with the correct colouring but disabled

### Actual behavior

Buttons using the `disabled` attribute, in conjunction with `is-success` class, are white (so invisible on a white background)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Buttons using is-<info/success/warning/danger> and disabled are white in Safari 15.4" (#3515)

Issues.Title: Given names to the 2 'Variable' sections
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->
Similar to #3513
There are 2 'Variables' sections on the [Forms>General Page](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/general/#variables), both with the same title.

### Proposed solution
Set `anchor_name` for both sections.

### Tradeoffs

The names may not be obvious to what it is. It may be better to combine the 2 sets of variables into one.

### Testing Done

Yes, fix works on my system.

### Changelog updated?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Given names to the 2 'Variable' sections" (#3514)

Issues.Title: Bump nanoid from 3.1.30 to 3.3.4
Issues.Body:
Bumps [nanoid](https://github.com/ai/nanoid) from 3.1.30 to 3.3.4.
Changelog

Sourced from nanoid's changelog.

3.3.4

  • Fixed --help in CLI (by @​Lete114).

3.3.3

  • Reduced size (by Anton Khlynovskiy).

3.3.2

  • Fixed enhanced-resolve support.

3.3.1

  • Reduced package size.

3.3

  • Added size argument to function from customAlphabet (by Stefan Sundin).

3.2

  • Added --size and --alphabet arguments to binary (by Vitaly Baev).

3.1.32

  • Reduced async exports size (by Artyom Arutyunyan).
  • Moved from Jest to uvu (by Vitaly Baev).

3.1.31

  • Fixed collision vulnerability on object in size (by Artyom Arutyunyan).
Commits
  • fc5bd0d Release 3.3.4 version
  • 5ae2628 Update dependencies
  • 2f48e9c Try to fix CI
  • 85991e3 fix: CLI help examples (#361)
  • 89d994c Update dependencies
  • 00547e7 Fix benchmark order
  • a8f4099 bench: add back @​napi-rs/uuid (#360)
  • acd897f Added postgres extension to various README files (#359)
  • 772a613 Update CI and dependencies
  • e7aeb0f Added zig-nanoid to readme. (#357)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Issues.Title: Support for input type="range", aka a slider
Issues.Body:
This is a feature request about **Bulma**.
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.3

### Description

Will there be support for styling
```
<input type="range"/>
```
any time soon?

This has been requested before in #67 and would have been solved in the PR #647 which was rejected.
What is the current state for this? I would like to use a slider, but I am not a CSS expert, hence why I am using a CSS framework like Bulma.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support for input type="range", aka a slider" (#3518)

Issues.Title: The navbar overlaps with sidebars in "Fullheight hero with navbar"
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about the Docs.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->
It's a bug. It's not a browser bug.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
My **browser** is: Firefox
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**
I've searched the past issues and i haven't found anything similar.

### Description

The hero with navbar is on top of the sidebars. I'm quite sure this is not a browser bug, as it's reproducible in Edge.

### Steps to Reproduce

Go to [this page](https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/#fullheight-with-navbar) and open any sidebar while being in the "Fullheight hero with navbar" section.

### Expected behavior

The hero with navbar should be behind the sidebars.

### Actual behavior


The hero with navbar is on top of the sidebars.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The navbar overlaps with sidebars in "Fullheight hero with navbar" " (#3510)

Issues.Title: Fixes #3383 ('Variables' sections on docs page)
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **documentation fix**.
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
Related to issue  #3383

There are 2 Variables sections on the [variables page](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/variables/#variables) with the same ID's and no gap between them. The right hand menu shows 2 Variable sections which both take you to the first one of the 2 variable sections.

### Proposed solution

1. Give each variables section a different name, by using the `anchor_name` as the section title
2. Add gap between consecutive variable 'divs' (identified by class="bd-vars")

### Tradeoffs

None that I can see.

### Testing Done

Some...
Fixes problem on the [variables page](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/variables/#variables), but may cause unintended issues on other pages which use the modified file if they have an `anchor_name` set which should not be used for the section title.

### Changelog updated?

No.

### Screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47078235/165308041-664d6fdc-c635-427c-a9ee-224c6b38badf.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fixes #3383 ('Variables' sections on docs page)" (#3513)

``` ### Expected behavior Images should respect the responsive behavior. ### Actual behavior Images are disappeared.

Issues.Title: Sizing classes for checkbox, radio, and help
Issues.Body: This is a **requested feature** for **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.3] ### Description Support the classes `is-small`, `is-medium`, and `is-large` on the form input types `checkbox` and `radio`, as well as the form class `help` ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Copy the example code from [bulma/complete-form-example](https://bulma.io/documentation/form/general/#complete-form-example) into a project setup with Bulma 2. Add sizing classes to label and input elements (ie. `is-large`) 3. Render the content ### Expected behavior The entire form is scaled proportionally ### Actual behavior All form components are scaled proportionally, except for `checkbox`, `radio`, and `help`. https://codesandbox.io/s/bulma-form-sizes-demo-jzo29c --- P.S. I'm awful with CSS and making nice designs. Bulma has been awesome! I really appreciate all the work you're doing. Thank you! 😁
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Sizing classes for checkbox, radio, and help" (#3508)

Issues.Title: null checks on !default variables are useless because they can't be null
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.3]
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

Consider this code from Bulma's SASS source: https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/e5ee280b32c2bac94e363013777ff41d1a9ed2dc/sass/helpers/spacing.sass#L9-L31

`$spacing-horizontal` and `$spacing-vertical` have `!default` to make the customizable.
From the SASS documentation:
> To make this possible, Sass provides the !default flag. This assigns a value to a variable only if that variable isn’t defined or its value is [null](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/values/null). Otherwise, the existing value will be used.

This means that both of these variables can **never be** null. If they get set to null outside, `!default` kicks in and overwrites that value.
This means not only that the null checks are useless, but also that the generation of these classes can't be turned off, which was probably intended.
I found this tweet which claims that an empty list / array works instead, but it creates an error when i try to compile it because at least in the current versions of SASS, an empty list is not equal to null: https://twitter.com/TweetsOfSumit/status/1346502700893155328?s=20&t=ZSeM19qMCyagy71ppkyNpw
And even if that was true, it's not documented anywhere.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "null checks on !default variables are useless because they can't be null" (#3507)

Issues.Title: Allow customization of typography $alignments in SASS
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.3
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [not relevant]
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Allow customization of `sass/helpers/typography.sass` -> `$alignments`.
https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/e5ee280b32c2bac94e363013777ff41d1a9ed2dc/sass/helpers/typography.sass#L29
I think it should be as easy as appending `!default` which worked for me but i'm not too sure if it could break something else.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow customization of typography $alignments in SASS" (#3506)

Issues.Title: How to know which files can be excluded from building?
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

This is about **building Bulma**.
This is about **the Docs**.
I need help and have a feature suggestion.

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

My aim is to keep my css as slim as possible. I only use some of bulmas features and do not know how to see which files I can exclude from building into my css.

I want this to be accessible to anyone with this problem, but this is what I use in particular: 

- hero
- columns
- breakpoints (using `@include from($tablet) {`)
- the defaults for styling (normalize)

How can I learn which files I need and which can be excluded?

This question comes with two ideas:

1. There could be a builder / file picker that generates a partial based on what it finds being used in the html files.
2. The docs could include a "requires" section for each page of the docs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "How to know which files can be excluded from building?" (#3505)
